xxl.core.math.numerics.integration
Class TrapezoidalRuleRealFunctionArea

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.RealFunctionArea
      xxl.core.math.numerics.integration.TrapezoidalRuleRealFunctionArea

public class TrapezoidalRuleRealFunctionArea
extends RealFunctionArea

This class provides the numerical integration of a real-valued function that is defined over an interval [a,b]. For the integration the Trapezoidal Rule is applied. The Trapezoidal Rule belongs to the Newton-Cotes-Formulas and bases on two weights, providing an approximation of order 2. By partitioning the interval, the Trapezoidal Rule can be applied iteratively.

See Also:
RealFunction, RealFunctionArea, SimpsonsRuleRealFunctionArea

Method Detail

eval

public double eval(double a,
                   double b)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Computes the area "under" the given real-valued function for the interval [a,b]. The Trapezoidal Rule is applied iteratively until the defined error threshold is reached.

Overrides:
eval in class RealFunctionArea
Parameters:
a - left border of the integration interval
b - right border of the integration interval
Returns:
numerical approximation of the integral
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - invalid parameters

trapez

public static double trapez(double a,
                            double b,
                            Function real1DFunction,
                            int n)
Computes the area under a real-valued function in a given interval [a,b] using the Trapezoidal Rule for numerical integration iteratively with a given number of steps.

Parameters:
a - left border of the integration interval
b - right border of the integration interval
n - number of steps used for computation
real1DFunction - real-valued (1D) function to integrate numerically
Returns:
numerical approximation of the integral

trapez

public static double trapez(double a,
                            double b,
                            Function real1DFunction,
                            double maxF2Dev,
                            double epsilon)
Computes the area under a real-valued function in a given interval [a,b] using the Trapezoidal Rule for numerical integration iteratively. The error is bounded through the absolute maximum of the second deviation of the function. The number of iterations in turn depends on this error estimation.

Parameters:
a - left border of the integration interval
b - right border of the integration interval
real1DFunction - real-valued (1D) function to integrate numerically
maxF2Dev - absolute maximum of the second derivative of the given function max |f''(x)|
epsilon - error threshold
Returns:
numerical approximation of the integral

trapezx

public static double trapezx(double a,
                             double b,
                             Function real1DFunction,
                             double epsilon)
Computes the area under a real-valued function in a given interval [a,b] using the Trapezoidal Rule for numerical integration until an error threshold is reached. For estimating the error, |T(n) - T (n/2)| <= epsilon * |T(n)| is used.

Parameters:
a - left border of the integration interval
b - right border of the integration interval
real1DFunction - real-valued (1D) function to integrate numerically
epsilon - error threshold used as |T(n) - T ( n/2)| <= epsilon * |T(n)|
Returns:
numerical approximation of the integral
